how do i blow away my xorg.conf and get: [xorg] how do i blow away my xorg.conf and get a shiny new one?
in a terminal type: sudo mv /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg.conf.backup    ..then restart X
that's it? i just move it and it will be auto regened? even with a binary driver selected?
someone else told me sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
if one doesn't exist one will be created; on versions befor 9.10
that too would create a new one but why get rid of the old one without making a back up.
since you're on 9.10 you will not get a new xorg.conf but things will be auto detected.
one more thing.. how do i restart x? i can delete the file (i already backed it up before)
so i SHOULDNT RM my xorg.conf?
make backups rather than deleting. much safer.. sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart  .will restart X ..if you're using gnome
sudo service gdm restart is the preferred method on 9.10 and beyond.
thanks but you did not answer my question. i already did make backups.. but you say things will be autodetected but it won't create a new xorg.conf?
with 9.10 i do not believe so. xorg.conf is depreciated from 9.10 on.  things are autodetected and run. although an xorg.conf can be used to specify things you want.
OHHHHHHHHHHH thanks... i didn't know that... okay so my plan is to rm my xorg.conf (already backed up), restart X, then try to install latest nvidia binary 195.30
